Analyze calls by peak detection.

Source: R/analyze_peaks.R
analyze_peaks.Rd

This function carries out a peak-detection analysis to determine QC for clonal simple CNAs, clonal complex CNAs and subclonal CNAs.

Several scores are produced and returned; functions to visualize results are also available (see the tool website for example usages).

analyze_peaks(
  x,
  karyotypes = c("1:0", "1:1", "2:0", "2:1", "2:2"),
  min_karyotype_size = 0,
  min_absolute_karyotype_mutations = 100,
  p_binsize_peaks = 0.005,
  matching_epsilon = NULL,
  purity_error = 0.05,
  VAF_tolerance = 0.015,
  n_bootstrap = 1,
  kernel_adjust = 1,
  matching_strategy = "closest",
  KDE = TRUE,
  starting_state_subclonal_evolution = "1:1"
)

Arguments

x

An object of class cnaqc, created by the init function.

karyotypes

The list of karyotypes to test. By default LOH regions (A, AA), diploid regions (AB), and amplification regions (AAB, AABB). These correspond to '1:0', '1:1', '2:1', '2:0', '2:2' in "Major:minor" notation.

min_karyotype_size

Karyotypes are subset by their size (normalized for the number of input mutations). Karyotypes smaller than this value are removed from analysis.

min_absolute_karyotype_mutations

As min_karyotype_size this imposes a minimum number of mutations on a karyotype to be analysed (in absolute number of mutations). Karyotypes smaller than this value are removed from analysis.

p_binsize_peaks

Peaks detected will be filtered if, in a peak, we map less than p_binsize_peaks * N mutations. The value N is obtained couting all mutations that map in all peaks.#'

matching_epsilon

Deprecated parameter.

purity_error

Purity error tolerance to determine QC results. This can be set automatically using function auto_tolerance

VAF_tolerance

A tolerance in comparing bands overlaps - this is applied to the raw VAF values.

n_bootstrap

Number of times peak detection is bootstrapped (this helps sometimes finding peaks that might be visually observable but fail to be detected by the underlying peak detection heuristic). The default of this parameter is 1, meaning that no bootstrap is performed.

kernel_adjust

KDE adjust density parameter; see density. A Gaussian kernel is used (kernel = 'gaussian').

matching_strategy

If "closest", the closest peak will be used to match the expected peak. If "rightmost", peaks are matched prioritizing right to left peaks (the higher get matched first); this strategy is more correct in principle but works only if there are no spurious peaks in the estimated density. By defaule the first strategy is used.

KDE

Deprecated parameter (unused).

starting_state_subclonal_evolution

Starting state to determine linear versus branching evolutionary model, for sublonal CNA QC.

Value

An object of class cnaqc, modified to hold the results from this analysis. See the vignette to see how to extract and plot the results.

Examples

data('example_dataset_CNAqc', package = 'CNAqc')
x = init(example_dataset_CNAqc$mutations, example_dataset_CNAqc$cna,example_dataset_CNAqc$purity)
#>  [ CNAqc - CNA Quality Check ] 
#> 
#> Error in init(example_dataset_CNAqc$mutations, example_dataset_CNAqc$cna,     example_dataset_CNAqc$purity): Avoid using `snvs` if you use `mutations

x = analyze_peaks(x)
#> Error in stopifnot(inherits(x, "cnaqc")): object 'x' not found
print(x)
#> Error in print(x): object 'x' not found

print(x$peaks_analysis)
#> Error in print(x$peaks_analysis): object 'x' not found

x = analyze_peaks(x, matching_strategy = "rightmost")
#> Error in stopifnot(inherits(x, "cnaqc")): object 'x' not found
print(x)
#> Error in print(x): object 'x' not found
